meanings.definition: The property of a system in which all possible states are visited over time.
meanings.sent1: The ergodicity of the system ensures that every state is explored eventually.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the ergodicity of the system to understand its behavior over time.
meanings.sent3: The party game demonstrated ergodicity as each player took turns in different roles.
meanings.sent4: The concept of ergodicity is like a curious traveler exploring every corner of a new city.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a fun activity to explain ergodicity to the students, ensuring they understood the idea of exploring all possibilities.

meanings.definition: The property of a system in which the statistical properties of the system can be deduced from a single, sufficiently long sample.
meanings.sent1: By analyzing a long enough sample, researchers can determine the ergodicity of the system.
meanings.sent2: The ergodicity of the data set allowed for accurate predictions about the entire system.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick with cards showcased the surprising ergodicity of shuffling patterns.
meanings.sent4: The concept of ergodicity in statistics is like unraveling a mystery from a single clue.
meanings.sent5: The detective used the principle of ergodicity to solve the case, piecing together information from a single source.
